gov.nasa.arc.mct.gui
Class FeedView

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component

          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  gov.nasa.arc.mct.gui.View
                      gov.nasa.arc.mct.gui.FeedView
All Implemented Interfaces:
ViewProvider, LockObserver, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
Direct Known Subclasses:
MultiViewManifestation
public abstract class FeedView
extends View

This is the super class for feed displays. All feed views are painted by periodic feed data at most once per second. Special requests for data (perhaps for historical data) are excluded from this normalized refreshing. A subclass must do the following:

  • Override updateFromFeed(Map) to refresh the view with the incoming data set.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail

updateFromFeed

public abstract void updateFromFeed(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>>> data)
Updates the view manifestation because of a change in the data available from the feed. This method will be invoked for periodic refreshes as well as special requests from data. Invocation of this method from the MCT platform will always be in the AWT thread.

Parameters:
data - to update this view with. The map will contain a mapping from subscriptionId for each feed to the list (time sequenced) set of values. The will be one element in the list for each change occurring during the last paint cycle. There will be at least one data point per time unit.

requestData

public javax.swing.SwingWorker<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>>>,java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>>>> requestData(java.util.Collection<FeedProvider> providers,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              long startTime,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              long endTime,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              FeedView.DataTransformation transformer,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              FeedView.RenderingCallback renderer,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              boolean reverseOrder)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Perform a special request for data. Invoking this method is asynchronous and will return immediately, the transformer and renderer callback parameters are used to transform data off the AWT thread and to render the data. The data request may be split in multiple requests which are dispatched incrementally.

Parameters:
providers - to use for the data retrieval operation. If this argument is null, then the return value from getVisibleFeedProviders(). No attempt is made to subscribe to ongoing events for feed providers.
startTime - to use for the request, in milliseconds since January 1, 1970
endTime - to use for the request, in milliseconds since January 1, 1970
transformer - to use during the background processing (this will not be invoked in the AWT thread). Null can be passed, in which case no transformation will be applied to the data.
renderer - to use for visualizing the data. This will be invoked in the AWT thread and must not be null.
reverseOrder - true if the data should be retrieved in reverse order, with the slice containing the end time arriving first, false otherwise.
Returns:
SwingWorker representing the running task, which may be canceled.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if renderer is null

synchronizeTime

public abstract void synchronizeTime(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>>> data,
                                     long syncTime)
Update the view manifestation because of a request to synchronize all views to the given time. The definition of synchronization of time is specific to the view.

Parameters:
data - retrieved that was available at the syncTime
syncTime - to show in the view

synchronizationDone

Gets called when time synchronization is over.

synchronizeTime

public FeedView.SynchronizationControl synchronizeTime(long time)
Show the synchronize time in a view specific manner. BETA.

Parameters:
time - to synchronize across all views, in Unix Epoch time.
Returns:
control or null if time cannot currently be synchronized

getVisibleFeedProviders

public abstract java.util.Collection<FeedProvider> getVisibleFeedProviders()
Return feed providers current used in this manifestation. An implementation of this method should attempt to use visibility to only request feeds which are currently being used (instead of everything that could potentially be used). This method may be called from multiple threads and thus the implementation should ensure that iterating over the collection will not cause a concurrent modification exception. The easiest way to achieve this is to create the collection upon each subsequent change so the collection will only be write once.

Returns:
the feed providers currently visible in this component.

getFeedProvider

public FeedProvider getFeedProvider(AbstractComponent component)
A convenience method to retrieve a feed provider from a component.

Parameters:
component - to extract feed provider from
Returns:
FeedProvider instance or null if the component does not support feeds
